info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 28 at 5:54AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...AN AREA OF HEAVIER SNOW WILL AFFECT SOUTHEASTERN GREENE...FAYETTE... NORTHEASTERN MONONGALIA...NORTHERN PRESTON AND NORTH CENTRAL MARION COUNTIES... At 553 AM EST, an area of heavier snow was located over Point Marion, or near Star City, moving east at 30 mph. Winds in excess of 30 mph are possible with these snow showers along with rapid reductions in visibility and quick coatings of snow on roadways. Locations impacted include... Morgantown, Uniontown, Westover, Star City, Masontown, South Connellsville, Farmington, Fairdale, Jefferson Boro, Point Marion, Granville, Brookhaven, Cassville, Fairchance, Isabella, Dunbar, Smithfield, Bobtown, Republic, and Nemacolin. This includes the following highways... Interstate 68 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 31. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 9. Interstate 79 in West Virginia between mile markers 149 and 160. Snow will lead to reduced visibilities and hazardous travel conditions. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
